project_question:
Volume is a system that generates 3D models from single view 2D images and video using state-of-the-art Machine Learning research. It is intended to provide a way to reconstruct archival, historical and pre-existing images and video in 3D space.

By providing an interface to bridge between machine learning and storytelling practices, Volume enables content creators to easily prototype 3D assets from 2D images and video in Augmented, Virtual and Mixed reality environments. Volume is built as a cloud service, which abstracts all the machine learning processing and provides a simple interface to reconstruct and view your assets. Upon reconstruction, you are able to download and use these assets in popular game engines such as Unity, Unreal or Three.js using the Volume plugin.

Volume's main audience are content creators. By allowing anyone, with no previous coding background, to easily prototype 3D Volume encourages inclusion in the content creation process.
short_description: 3D photography and immersive mediums have been booming over the past years. Culturally, 2D images have been an integral part of how we develop an identity. Given the transition from 2D to 3D, how can we use historical, archival and pre-existing 2D images and video in the 3D era?
further_reading:
Tools:

Make - WebGL


Make Volume, is the online interface for content creators allowing to easily upload, save and export Volume assets from your personal account.

Volume Unity Plugin

Volume Unity Plugin allows you to easily render Volume exported assets. It is released as an open source tool.
Github

Volume API

The Volume machine learning algorithms are also accessible as a REST API allowing for easy integration into already existing applications that could harvest Volume's abilities.

Experiments:

Inside Pulp Fiction - Augmented Reality

Inside Pulp Fiction is the first video experiment made with Volume - a reconstruction of a scene from Pulp Fiction in Augmented Reality. The iconic dance contest scene from Pulp Fiction evolves to a volumetric space and allows viewers to step inside it and walk around John Travolta and Uma Thurman. The project was released as an open source project and is available here.

Read more on The Next Web, Motherboard or Discovery Channel.

Volume.GL - WebGL

Volume.GL is an experiment allowing anybody to upload their own images to Volume's website and reconstruct them as a 3D point cloud. Upload your own image to Volume's website
Read more on The Next Web or prosthetic knowledge

ReTouch - OpenGL

A desktop application that allows you to use Volume's machine learning predictions to allow for deep recoloring and retouching of images.

ReTouch is designed to demonstrate that Volume could be used in the background for assisting in other tasks (e.g color grading) and was released as an open source tool.
